On 21/06/05, ilkin ulas Balkanay <ilkinulas@...> wrote:
> Hi, i am using junit task in my build.xml to execute my unit tests and 
> then i use junitreport to generate html reports from unit test results.
> I want to see unit tests execution date, cvs tag for the executed tests 
> in the html reports generated by junitreport. Is there a way to 
> customize the junitreport task output?
> 
> ilkin Balkanay

By asking a "how can I alter an ANT task" question, you'd probably be better 
off posting the the ant-user list.

However, I think you could do something with this in classic ANT alone. It 
feels like there are three areas to cover. 

   1. You'd need to use the cvs tasks to get details of the tag unless 
   you already have that; 
   2. Use the timestamp task to get the execution date into a property; 
   3. Having your own xslt called by the xslt task that accepts 
   parameters containing the additional information you require; i.e. 
   execution date and cvs tag. This should transform the file produced by the 
   junit task's xml formatter into html for a project web site or similar. 


But that sounds like a fair bit of work in ANT xml alone - might be worth 
knocking together a custom task.

HTH

James
